comments.author: ted@mielczarek.org
comments.raw_text: I was looking at testing some things for bug 623617, but I got paranoid about breaking all the crazy corners of our build system, so I decided to start with writing some unit tests. If nothing else, it gives me a place to put more tests when I do find out that I broke something.
comments.creator: ted@mielczarek.org
comments.text: I was looking at testing some things for bug 623617, but I got paranoid about breaking all the crazy corners of our build system, so I decided to start with writing some unit tests. If nothing else, it gives me a place to put more tests when I do find out that I broke something.

Created attachment 502029
Add unit tests for build system functionality

This adds tests for building PROGRAM, static and shared LIBRARYs, and both a static and shared LIBRARY from the same code (which gives me a test for bug 467862, which is nice).
comments.raw_text: This adds tests for building PROGRAM, static and shared LIBRARYs, and both a static and shared LIBRARY from the same code (which gives me a test for bug 467862, which is nice).
comments.creator: ted@mielczarek.org
comments.author: ted@mielczarek.org

comments.text:
Comment on attachment 502029
Add unit tests for build system functionality

I think you should name the program test cpp to progtest.cpp to match the others.  Also, maybe the check target should remove the shlibs from dist/bin when it is done?
comments.creator: khuey@kylehuey.com
comments.raw_text: I think you should name the program test cpp to progtest.cpp to match the others.  Also, maybe the check target should remove the shlibs from dist/bin when it is done?
comments.author: khuey@kylehuey.com
ted@mielczarek.org
comments.raw_text: FINAL_TARGET is where binaries get installed to (it's usually dist/bin, but I override it in this patch), so nothing winds up outside of this dir.
comments.creator: ted@mielczarek.org
comments.text:
Comment on attachment 502029
Add unit tests for build system functionality

FINAL_TARGET is where binaries get installed to (it's usually dist/bin, but I override it in this patch), so nothing winds up outside of this dir.

comments.creator: khuey@kylehuey.com
comments.raw_text: Ah, missed that.  Looks good then.
comments.text: Ah, missed that.  Looks good then.
